In terms of TFC, the oil of T. minuta (63.79±0.1 mg/g, p < 0.05) was richer in flavonoids, than the extract (14.86±0.4 mg/g, p < 0.05) ( Table 4). Previously, Kaisoon et al. discovered that the flowers of this genus had 68.9 mg/g of flavonoid content.
30 Flavonoids are a large family of plant polyphenolics that act as free-radical scavengers and the biological function is related to their chemical structure (hydroxyl groups).
